Explanations about Options.-x:
Simplified reverse lookups, for mapping addresses to names. The addr is an IPv4
 address in dotted-decimal notation, or a colon-delimited IPv6 address. When the -x is
 used, there is no need to provide the name, class and type arguments. dig
 automatically performs a lookup for a name like 94.2.0.192.in-addr.arpa and sets the
 query type and class to PTR and IN respectively. IPv6 addresses are looked up using
 nibble format under the IP6.ARPA domain.

Explanations about Options.-l:
Search the library named library when linking. (The second alternative with the
 library as a separate argument is only for POSIX compliance and is not recommended.)
Explanations about Options.-p:
Generate extra code to write profile information suitable for the analysis program
 prof (for -p) or gprof (for -pg). You must use this option when compiling the source
 files you want data about, and you must also use it when linking.
Explanations about Options.-c:
If any of these options is used, then the linker is not run, and object file names
 should not be used as arguments.
Explanations about Options.-o:
Place output in file file. This applies to whatever sort of output is being produced,
 whether it be an executable file, an object file, an assembler file or preprocessed C
 code.
